Job Title: Solution Architect

Location: Sacramento, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Engineering, Information Technology

Description:
HTC Global Services wants you. Come build new things with us and advance your career. At HTC Global you'll collaborate with experts. You'll join successful teams contributing to our clients' success. You'll work side by side with our clients and have long-term opportunities to advance your career with the latest emerging technologies.

At HTC Global Services our consultants have access to a comprehensive benefits package. Benefits can include Paid-Time-Off, Paid Holidays, 401K matching, Life and Accidental Death Insurance, Short & Long Term Disability Insurance, and a variety of other perks.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Microsoft Power Platform Expert to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess deep expertise in Microsoft Power Platform, including capabilities, limitations, and best practices. The Solution Architect will play a crucial role in assessing the suitability of the Power Platform for various use cases and business requirements, designing complex technical solutions, and ensuring alignment with both business objectives and technical requirements. If you have a passion for low-code development, strong integration skills, and a knack for designing scalable and reliable solutions, we encourage you to apply.

Responsibilities

Assess the suitability of low-code platforms, particularly Microsoft Power Platform, for various use cases and business requirements.Conceptualize and design complex technical solutions using low-code platforms, ensuring alignment with business objectives and technical requirements.Utilize strong knowledge of integration patterns and techniques to connect low-code platforms with external systems, APIs, and data sources.Design scalable and reliable integration solutions leveraging low-code platform connectors and APIs.Architect low-code solutions for scalability, performance, and resilience, considering factors such as data volume, transaction throughput, and user concurrency.Design and optimize solution architectures to meet performance requirements and accommodate future growth.Implement security controls, identity management, and data protection mechanisms within low-code architectures.Design processes for version control, release management, and environment provisioning within low-code platform environments.Align technical decisions with business objectives, strategic initiatives, and long-term goals.

Qualifications

5+ years of low-code platform experience with at least 3 years of experience with Microsoft Power PlatformAbility to configure and set up Microsoft Power Platform from scratch, including leveraging COE toolkit is requiredProficiency in assessing the suitability of low-code platforms for various use cases and business requirements.Strong ability to conceptualize and design complex technical solutions using low-code platforms.Knowledge of integration patterns and techniques for connecting low-code platforms with external systems, APIs, and data sources.Experience in architecting scalable and reliable integration solutions using low-code platform connectors and APIs.Understanding of security controls, identity management, and data protection mechanisms within low-code architectures.Familiarity with version control, release management, and environment provisioning processes within low-code platform environments.Excellent communication, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Information Technology, or related field preferred.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
